-      <div class="main">
-        <a name="support" id="support"></a>
-<h2>User Support</h2>
-
-<p>Got Enigma and looking for more information? For upcoming questions we
-wrote manuals and collected FAQ's. The documentation should reveal a lot of
-features that you may look for. If you are stuck on a level or just want to
-discuss Enigma with others you should have a look at the forum. You can actively
-participate to Enigma as a user by submitting your scores and ratings of levels.
-Your results will be part of the statistics evaluation and will be your vote
-for the level of the month.</p>
-
-<ul>
-  <li><a href="support_ru.html#documentation">Documentation</a> - The most up to date release packages - start here.</li>
-  <li><a href="faq_ru.html">FAQ</a> - Frequently asked questions (and their answers).</li>
-  <li><a href="support_ru.html#forum">Forum</a> - Discuss Enigma with other users.</li>
-  <li><a href="support_ru.html#score">Score Registration</a> - Submit your scores and ratings.</li>
-  <li><a href="statistics_ru.html">Score Statistics</a> - See how you and others played Enigma.</li>
-  <li><a href="support_ru.html#bug">Bug Reporting</a> - How to report bugs.</li>
-  <li><a href="support_ru.html#donation">Donation</a> - How to support the Enigma development.</li>
-</ul>
-
-  <p>Have fun!</p>
-
-<h3><a class="arrowup" href="support_ru.html"><img src="images/nav_up.gif" alt="Up" border="0" title="back to top"></a>
-  <a name="documentation">Documentation for Enigma 1.00</a></h3>
-  <p>The complete user manual is included in multiple languages with every release
-  of Enigma. You can additionally access it from this site or download a PDF
-  version of the document.</p>
-
-  <ul> <!-- keep space in first li entry - IE needs it -->
-    <li> <img src="images/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="English" title="English">&nbsp;&nbsp;
-      <a href="manual/enigma.html">English User manual (html)</a></li>
-    <li><img src="images/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="English" title="English">&nbsp;&nbsp;
-      <a href="manual/enigma.pdf">English User manual (pdf)</a></li>
-    <li><img src="images/flags25x15/de.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="German" title="German">&nbsp;&nbsp;
-      <a href="manual/enigma_de.html">Deutsches Benutzerhandbuch (html)</a></li>
-    <li><img src="images/flags25x15/de.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="German" title="German">&nbsp;&nbsp;
-      <a href="manual/enigma_de.pdf">Deutsches Benutzerhandbuch (pdf)</a></li>
-    <li><img src="images/flags25x15/fr.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="French" title="French">&nbsp;&nbsp;
-      <a href="manual/enigma_fr.html">Manuel Fran&ccedil;ais (html)</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;
-      finished after 1.00 release!</li>
-    <li><img src="images/flags25x15/ru.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="Russian" title="Russian">&nbsp;&nbsp;
-      <a href="manual/enigma_ru.html">Russian User manual (html)</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;
-      finished after 1.00 release!</li>
-    <li><img src="images/flags25x15/ru.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="Russian" title="Russian">&nbsp;&nbsp;
-      <a href="manual/enigma_ru.pdf">Russian User manual (pdf)</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;
-      finished after 1.00 release!</li>
-  </ul>
-
-  <p>Further on we provide a reference manual which is included in the Enigma
-  package, too. Many details listed here will be helpful not only for
-  power users and developers.</p>
-  <ul> <!-- keep space in first li entry - IE needs it -->
-    <li> <img src="images/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="English" title="English">&nbsp;&nbsp;
-      <a href="manual/enigma-ref.html">English Reference manual (html)</a></li>
-  </ul>
-  <p>No other translations of the Enigma manuals are available so far.
-  Please send an email to <a
-  href="mailto:enigma-devel at nongnu.org">enigma-devel at nongnu.org</a> if
-  you would like to contribute a translation.</p>
-
-<h3><a class="arrowup" href="support_ru.html"><img src="images/nav_up.gif" alt="Up" border="0" title="back to top"></a>
-  <a name="forum">User Forum</a></h3>
-
-  <p>Playing a game like Enigma causes a demand for communication. You may want
-  to discuss your solution of a level with others or you may search for some tiny
-  hints for others. On the forum <a href="http://www.mag-heut.net">mag-heut.net</a>
-  you can share your experience with hundreds of other users.</p>
-
-  <p>Just a request on behalf of all forum users: please search for discussion
-  threads that have been started to the same topic, e.g. level. Append your
-  remark or question via 'reply' instead of starting a new thread.</p>
-
-  <p>And another request on behalf of the level authors: do not spoil levels by publishing
-  walkthrough solutions. Even other users will usually prefer decent hints. The
-  forum offers the possibility to write hints with the same color as the background
-  (color &quot;spoiler&quot;). Users will see the hints without being directly
-  able to read them. By selecting the text you can read the hints you have
-  need of. Keep the fascination alive for all users.</p>
-
-<h3><a class="arrowup" href="support_ru.html"><img src="images/nav_up.gif" alt="Up" border="0" title="back to top"></a>
-  <a name="score">Score and Rating Registration</a></h3>
-
-  <p>Starting with Enigma 1.00 you can register your scores and ratings. Why is
-  it useful to submit your results? Based on as many user results as possible
-  we calculate statistics that you use when you inspect a level's info. Thus even
-  the fact that many users did not solve certain levels is as important as the
-  knowledge of top scores for improving Enigma.</p>
-
-  <p>Please take the time to rate levels. Right or ctrl click on
-  the level icon in the level menu to view the level inspector. At the bottom
-  line you can rate a level with values from 0 (bad) to 10 (top). Try to judge
-  bad levels as well as good levels. Average levels should be judged by a value
-  of 5. Your judgement shows which levels users like and is the basis for the
-  'Level of the Month' selection.</p>
-
-  <p>You need to choose a unique user name in the options menu. Please look at
-  the <a href="statistics_ru.html#userlist">users&nbsp;list</a> if your favorite name
-  is not in use by someone else.</p>
-
-  <p>For registration of your scores, just send us your 'enigma.score'
-  file. It is located at your 'user path' that Enigma shows you on
-  pressing F2 at the main menu. Please send just this one file to
-  <a href="mailto:score at enigma-game.org">score at enigma-game.org</a>
-  with subject 'score - username' (substitute 'username' by
-  the name you have chosen!).</p>
-
-  <p> The scores are evaluated on a monthly base. Please do not send your score file
-  after every good score that you achieved. Once at the end of the month is
-  sufficient.</p>
-
-  <p>The updated statistics will be downloaded to your computer if you set the
-  ratings update option to 'Auto'. Enigma will peek the server only a few times
-  per month, independent how often you start the application. The network traffic
-  is very low as just increments are downloaded and you will receive all updates
-  within a few days.</p>
-
-  <p>If you play most times offline and set the update option to 'Never'
-  you may manually download the ratings update file
-  <a href="http://www.nongnu.org/enigma/ratings/ratings.xml.zip">ratings.xml</a>.
-  Extract the file from the zip and copy it to your 'user path' aside
-  your 'enigma.score' file.</p>
-
-<h3><a class="arrowup" href="support_ru.html"><img src="images/nav_up.gif" alt="Up" border="0" title="back to top"></a>
-  <a name="bug">Bug Reporting</a></h3>
-
-  <p>We appreciate any report about problems with Enigma. Of course a software
-  with more than 200&nbsp;000 lines of code and complex gaming logic like Enigma is
-  never bug free. But Enigma reached a quite stable 1.00 release with many
-  thousands of users. Please first look at the documentation, FAQ and user
-  forum for possible similar reports.</p>
-
-  <p>For problems besides the solvability of levels send a mail to the developers
-  mailing list <a href="mailto:enigma-devel at nongnu.org" >enigma-devel at nongnu.org</a>
-  (you do not need to subscribe to the list).
-  Please include the following basic information:</p>
-    <ul>
-    <li>What operating system are you using?</li>
-    <li>Which Enigma version are you using?</li>
-    <li>What did you do when the bug happened?</li>
-    <li>What exactly did you see then?</li>
-    <li>Is the problem ongoing or reproduceable?</li>
-    </ul>
-  <p>If you file a report please stay tuned on and answer further requests on
-  specific details by our developers. Do not expect immediate answers - it may
-  take some time for the right people to answer your request.</p>
-
-  <p>Problems with single levels should be reported to the user forum
-  <a href="http://www.mag-heut.net">mag-heut.net</a>. Please keep in mind that
-  all levels have been proven solvable with Enigma 1.00. But unintended shortcuts
-  or annoyances with levels will remain an ongoing topic and may sometimes emerge
-  to be caused by inconsistencies within Enigma itself.</p>
-
-  <p>Developers may want to file bug reports directly to our bug database at
-  <a href="http://developer.berlios.de/projects/enigma-game/">Berlios.</a>
-
-<h3><a class="arrowup" href="support_ru.html"><img src="images/nav_up.gif" alt="Up" border="0" title="back to top"></a>
-  <a name="donation">Donation</a></h3>
-
-  <p>We are just wondering if users would be willing to support the further
-  development of Enigma financially. Just donating a fraction of the amount
-  you would be willing to spend for a commercial 'Enigma' in a store
-  would help us to improve Enigma. If you think this would be a fair deal, send
-  us mail to <a href="mailto:donation at enigma-game.org" >donation at enigma-game.org</a>
-  and we will set up a donation account dedicated to Enigma.</p>
-
